pages.text: Palaeophragmodictya comes from the Upper Ediacaran, with fossils found in the White Sea, Russia and Flinders Ranges, South Australia. It is a sponge-like lifeform, growing up to 7 cm in diameter, with a 'stalk' rising 10+ cm up into the water column. The generic name derives from the Greek word 'Palaeos', to mean 'ancient', and the species name of 'Phragmodictya', a Carboniferous dictyosponge.
